alert.note: Alert for Carter (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 6:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Carter County through 715 PM EDT... At 645 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Haldeman, or near Olive Hill, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Olive Hill, Grayson Lake State Park, Carter Caves State Park, Grahn, Soldier, Globe and Willard. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 150 and 168. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
